result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:02 AM Cases called: 21CM269, 22CM12, 22CM13, 22CM42, and 22CM170. Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nichole Renee Sandstrom in court.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Nichole Renee Sandstrom. Agreement recited by State. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled guilty to count 1 of 22CM42, count 2 of 21CM269, and to count 2 of 22CM13. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. All remaining charges and cases are dismissed but read in. Sentencing statements. Court withheld sentencing on each count, and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months. Conditions of probation include: Submit DNA sample. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Successfully complete domestic abuse counseling. Costs of $443.00 on count 1 of 22CM42, $443.00 on count 2 of 22CM13, and $543.00 on count 2 of 21CM269. In 21CM269 1 day credit, 22CM13 4 days credit, and in 22CM42 19 days credit. 11:27 AM
filed by Atty Allison Borsheim, request for global plea date.
